sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: At least 15 people were killed in a strike on the UN school housing thousands in Gaza, marking the second attack on the school in just two days.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Thousands of people across the UK, France and Germany took part in pro-Palestinian protests, calling for an end to the Israel-Hamas war.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: The EU's top official arrives in Kiev for talks with President Volodymyr Zelensky as Ukraine seeks membership of the EU.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: At least 15 people were killed in the Israeli strike on the UN school housing thousands of displaced civilians in the Gaza Strip.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Dozens more were wounded.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The attack comes just a day after a strike on another school converted into a makeshift shelter killed at least 20 people.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: This, as two people were killed earlier in a strike by the Gate of Nasser Hospital in Gaza City, an attack the World Health Organization has called unacceptable.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: According to Gaza's health ministry, at least 231 people were killed in the past day, while more than 9,400 Palestinians have been killed since October 7, including 3,900 children.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: On Saturday, Israel offered a three-hour window for trapped residents to flee south, although it's not clear how many fled.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: About 1.5 million people in Gaza, or 70% of the population, have already been displaced, according to the UN.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Meanwhile, Israel's defense minister has said that at least 12 Hamas battalion commanders have been killed in the IDF's ground offensive in Gaza.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: U.S. Secretary of State Antony Blinken was in Jordan on Saturday for a bid to build support for planning a post-war future for Gaza.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: He met with weary Arab leaders and officials angry and deeply suspicious of Israel as it intensifies military operations in the Gaza Strip.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: More than 9,400 people have died in the Palestinian enclave since the war began in October.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: And 9,400 people have died in the Palestinian enclave since the war began in October.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Among them were 72 UN staffers who have died in Israeli airstrikes.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Thousands are putting their lives on the line every single day to show up at work to help people. I have extraordinary admiration for the courage that they're showing.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Calls for humanitarian pause has increased as the UN has reported the average Palestinian in Gaza is surviving on two pieces of bread a day.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Only one of three water supply lines from Israel is operational.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: from Israel is operational.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Thousands of pro-Palestinian demonstrators marched through central London on Saturday, calling on Israel to stop its bombardment of Gaza.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The protest was held as Israeli troops tightened their encirclement of Gaza City.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The death toll for the Palestinian enclave has reached 9,448.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: In Berlin, thousands more took part in a free Palestine protest, calling for the end of the war.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Another 60,000 pro-Palestinian protesters gathered in Paris, while some 40 other rallies were announced across France.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Meanwhile, some families of the Israeli hostages taken by Hamas set up camp in Tel Aviv on Saturday, calling for their return.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: At least 242 hostages were taken from Israel into Gaza by Hamas militants on 7 October, and more than 1,400 people in Israel have been killed.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen arrived in Kiev on Saturday morning for talks with President Volodymyr Zelensky.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: It comes just before the release of an EU report that will assess how Ukraine has gone towards meeting the criteria for EU membership.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: And it will play a critical role in determining whether the bloc agrees to start formal accession talks with Kyiv next month.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Wanda Lyon also paid tribute to Ukraine's railway workers.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: You have helped your compatriots to seek shelter in the European Union and come back home again.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: You got the grain and the vital products out of Ukraine and into the world.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: You keep the lifeline running.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: And it is outstanding. I can witness it because it is the sixth time that I've come to Kiev by train.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: And I must say, this train is a legend.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: At a special ceremony afterwards, employees of the state railway company were given awards legend.
